basis: The user explicitly commits to trying the plan today with concrete actions (water start, 0–10 hunger check, micro-pause in crowds, fallback breath/water, small options for hunger 4–7) and discusses triggers, indicating high likelihood of following through.
cognitive_dissonance: Low to moderate: tension between wanting strict adherence (pause in all settings) and comfort with shorter or fallback pauses in crowds; overall integration and self-kindness reduce conflict.
negative_thought_patterns: Self-criticism if slips occur; fear of judgment in crowded settings; perfectionist/all-or-nothing thinking about consistency across social situations and late nights.
emotional_triggers: Stress, crowds, late nights, heat; social scrutiny in crowds; need for hydration in hot weather.
coaching_notes: Keep delivering concrete, bite-size goals and simple fallbacks for social/crowded contexts. Reinforce self-compassion, track triggers, and prompt brief post-meal reflections to sustain motivation and identify patterns for tomorrow.
